reviews.text: Location wise Hawks Nest is centrally located in the middle of the keys, about an equal distance from Key West and Key Largo. It is an older resort and unlike most other timeshare units we have exchanged with there are no washer/dryers and they charge $25 for utilities. THIS IS NOT NORMAL FOR THE REGION!
reviews.title: This Place is just 'OK'

reviews.text: I've noticed a ton of glowing reports on this resort and I think they unfairly overhype the resort. Its strongest attributes is its location in the keys, view from the units (assuming you have a waterfront view) and free internet (its small but very much appreciated). But the unit I stayed in definitely could have used a remodel. I've stayed in places that are truly a 5 out of 5 and this is not one of them. It's an average resort with an above average location.
reviews.title: i come every year
Awsome
reviews.text: I come to the Hawks Nest every year and just because there is a tropical storm does NOT mean it is the Employees Fault...We have a fabulous time. There is a resteraunt that has opened unfortunately right down the road from the condo which will cause alot of traffic. I do not see them being open more than 2 years seeing that the location for a resteraunt is in a horrible desolate location surrounded by people that want a quiet vacation. Anyway the Hawks Nest has everything to do from renting their 2 fishing boats to pool, Jacuzzi, Pool Table, Ping Pong, Games, Books, and the condos are beautiful with very clean rooms and wonderful maid service. I LOVE IT>>>SEEEE IT SOOONN

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A lobster season paradise, A Home town condo, like apple pie. Been going there for 20 years. If this ole body holds up, I plan to go 20 more.
reviews.title: One of My Favorite Places

reviews.text: I have stayed at the Hawk's Nest three times during the third week of March. We have always had excellent weather. The Hawk's Nest isn't new or modern...but it is familiar and friendly. The rooms are spacious...the views exceptional. Although there's not alot do do in Marathon but lay out by the pool, Key West is just an hour away. Last trip we hit Key West three nights in a row...OY! I would recommend this facility to anyone. I only wish I was going this year...
reviews.title: Faithful Hawks Nest visitor
30-year veteran - love the place
reviews.text: We've been going to Hawk's Nest for over 30 years. My parents orginally bought 4 weeks of a time share there. Now I bring my own family

reviews.title: Never Again!!
reviews.text: Yes, it's not fancy - it's not a hotel. The building is 30+ years old. Yes, the elevator goes out every once in a while, so sometimes you might have to walk up a few floors. But that's part of the charm for us. Full kitchen in the apartment, and ice maker and grills downstairs. Wi-fi too!
